intro: Paraderris hainanensis, commonly known as the Hainan paraderris, is a flowering plant native to the island of Hainan in China. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its shrub-like growth habit. The plant produces small, showy flowers that are typically pink or white in color. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often found in moist, well-drained soils. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
